name: Governor's School for Government and International Studioes
summary: Ranked 13th nationally in 2013 by Newsweek and 10th by The Daily Best in 2014, Governor's School was were I was first introduced to computer programming and web development.

name: Virginia Tech
summary: Focusing on C++ and computer science theory, I began my college education at Virgina Tech. Here I developed a strong base of object oriented programming and the theory driving most of computer science.

name: Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU)
description: Bachelor's of Engineering in Computer Science
summary: After being offered an opportunity to convert a summer internship into a fulltime position in 2001, I transferred to VCU to continue my education.  Coding heavily in Java, I learned the importance of modular code and took courses focusing on artificial intelligence, parallel programming, and software design.

name: Johns Hopkins University
summary: Covering everything from getting and cleaning the data, analyzing the data, and making sure research was reproducable, these courses taught R and the ideas and procedures used to analyze sets of data. I achieved “100% with Distinction” grade from every course.

name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
description: Fundamentals of Computational Thinking and Data Science
summary: This course allowed me to reinforce my theoretical base in computer science. Utilizing Python, I worked to create many different theoretical models and enhanced the performance of Monte Carlo simulations and stochastic models.
